remarks: This lemma is used to prove that there exists a function x as in the proof of Lemma 2 in [BrosowskiDeutsh] p. 91: assuming that ` R ` is a finite subset of ` V ` , ` x ` indexes a finite set of functions in the subalgebra (of the Stone Weierstrass theorem), such that for all ` i ` ranging in the finite indexing set, 0 ≤ x_i ≤ 1, x_i < ε / m on V(t_i), and x_i > 1 - ε / m on ` B ` .  Here M is used to represent m in the paper, ` E ` is used to represent ε in the paper, v_i is used to represent V(t_i).  (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 20-Apr-2017.)
